Reviews.Title: “Worth the Marriott points for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: l1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in April, used my Marriott points. Hotel was very clean, room was also clean. Decor typical of smaller hotels in the Marriott chain. Had a breakfast buffet included. Variety was limited but there was plenty to fill you up, just be there before it closes at 9:30am on weekdays. I would stay here for another short stay if in the Phoenix area again.

Reviews.Title: “Needed an inexpensive place that was clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MactheHandiman
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fits the title. Everyone was friendly. Nice breakfast. clean, updated room. Candy bars were too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairfield - Do NOT depend on Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Melissa H
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Phoenix March 10-14 I was disappointed with the shuttle service on two occasions. The first experience was on Saturday we walked to a restaurant on 7th and Osborn Road (about 1.5 miles). The front desk staff told us the shuttle goes within a 3 mile radius and before we left we asked the staff and verified that the shuttle would pick us up. When I called at 8:07pm the receptionist told us it would be about 20 minutes and I verified with her 3 times our location. At 8:30pm we received a call telling us the shuttle was at Safeway – the one on 3rd and Osborn which was NOT where we were – she talked with the driver and told us they would be right there. This was the wrong location after I verified 3 times. At 8:38pm we were still waiting and when I called the hotel they told us they would contact the driver to find their location. At 8:47pm I called back and RaLynn told us the shuttle had to go to the convention center. We finally arrived back at the hotel at 9:02pm. Had the receptionist been honest with us, we would have walked. This was unprofessional and unacceptable customer service. The second instance occurred on Wednesday. Once again, we were depending on the shuttle to take us to the airport – the evening before we departed, we signed up for the 8am shuttle for March 14 (our plane departed at 9:55am). Normally, this would have been plenty of time, but the shuttle driver decided to take 4 people to their meeting destination which was well over the 3 mile radius (30 minutes to/30 minutes from) so we did not arrive to the airport until 9am. We would have missed our flight but luckily the flight had been delayed by 20 minutes. It would have been nice for us to have been dropped off for our flight (priority of missing a flight vs. being a few minutes late for a meeting) and since the shuttle does go to the airport and the other guests’ destination was outside the radius. The shuttle driver did not take any responsibility and there was no apology. I wrote to the hotel manager when I got home and I received what seemed like a canned letter to try and keep my business and gave excueses of why the shuttle service was not working properly. While I am a loyal Marriott reward member and will continue to stay at Marriott properties, I will definitely NOT be visiting this one again. I recommend all of you to stay at the Rennaissance by the Convention Center or another property.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Fairfield For A Wonderful Stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quaniz7
Reviews.Content: II was expecting mediocre and got a great value for my dollar! What a nice, clean and spacious place to stay while n Phoenix. The staff was professional and attentive – no phoniness – just real honest and kind people. The room was quite spacious, the bed was very comfortable, and there was a flat screen TV in the room with cable. It did not matter that we were not downtown Phoenix. There is a light rail one block away. We also walked to the Herd Museum which was a couple of blocks away. The hotel will take you to your destination if it is within 3 miles of the hotel. They provided airport shuttle service to and from the airport – so, we did not need to rent a vehicle and incur all those extra charges. I needed some sleep and got that because the hotel is in a quiet part of Phoenix, but convenient to all locations in the area. Please take these words to heart – you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: COLadyRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides all you could hope for from a Fairfield Inn. The rooms and common areas are clean and the hotel staff is remarkably friendly and helpful. The rooms are in need of some modernization - they are feeling quite dated. But they are roomy and tidy. The fourth floor rooms feature higher ceilings and nice tall windows. My room was quiet and I was able to work and rest in peace. I appreciate that the stairwells were clean and well-lit and basically usable -- I prefer stairs to elevators any day, provided the stairs aren't dark and creepy. In sum - nothing really remarkable, but no big, bad surprises, either. I will certainly return here in the future should business bring me this way again.

Reviews.Title: “Never had to use a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: YAYA014
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because most of the reviews were good and there was a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that the shuttle would also take me to my meeting so long the location was within 3 miles of the hotel. They also picked me up after the meeting and took me to the airport. Overall a great experience, room clean, breakfast very satisfying. I was only spending one night and not checking a bag so did not bring lotion figuring I would use the one the hotel provided. It was not standard issue. Only shampoo and conditioner was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: eciba
Reviews.Content: The only limitation I saw with this hotel was the parking. It was a bit crowded, but manageable. Staff was great. Room was above par. Hotel was clean and well maintained. We couldn't ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HenryBoston
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the quality of this hotel. Upon being picked up from the airport (in the complimentary airport shuttle), we were offered bottles of water (it was a hot day). We also took advantage of the airport shuttle for our return trip, and we were once again pleased. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. The hotel was always clean, as was our room. The complimentary breakfast was great; it included cereals, oatmeal, fruits, a waffle maker, juice, milk, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, toast, breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, muffins, coffee, and tea, and we could eat as much as we wanted to! The coffee and tea are also available 24 hours a day. The business center features 2 computers, a printer (maybe 2), and an ATM. The outdoor pool and whirlpool are very nice, clean, and well-kept. The "exercise room" could use some serious updating, but it's better than nothing. It features an old weight machine, stair-climber, and a broken treadmill. Additionally, there was a broken scale, towels, water, and a TV. The location of the hotel is convenient, however, it is not really near any nightlife or excitement. The light rail runs right by the hotel, and we were concerned that it would be loud, however, it was not. Our room was very quiet and the a/c unit worked perfectly. If your purpose for staying in this hotel is nightlife and fun, it is not recommended. However, if you are looking for a nice hotel in a central location, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Spacious Rooms, Nice Amenities”
Reviews.Author: SierraRose2005
Reviews.Content: Just a one-night stay, but it was perfect on all accounts. Staff was very pleasant and allowed us to check in early. Room was clean, quiet comfy with safe, microwave, fridge. 3rd Floor. Free Internet worked the first time we fired up computer (ethernet) and mobile (wi-fi). Decent complimentary breakfast (hot & cold) and USA Today. Small exercise room and guest laundry facilities. Nice 'pantry market' with shelf-stable meals and cold drinks you can buy. Near University Club where our meeting was held and Museums.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Quailty with a Marriott Price”
Reviews.Author: jdshaw971
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were not at all impressed with this hotel. The rooms are old and run-down and the staff isn't friendly. We were scheduled to stay for four nights and checked out after one. Our rate was $179/night... about $100 more than the hotel is worth. We won't stay there again and suggest you also look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned_Traveler084
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in January of 2011. The rooms were spacious, and fairly quiet. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous. I was traveling without a car, and the hotel shuttle was very helpful and friendly when picking us up from the airport, taking us around town, and taking us back to the airport. The breakfasts were fairly typical, but nothing fantastic. The Government rate was 126.00/night, which seemed a little pricey based on the room and amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! AWFUL customer service and management”
Reviews.Author: AdventuristGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here one night in July. I awoke to find a dozen swollen welts on my face and arms. We stripped the bed and found bed bugs crawling on the headboard and in the pillowcases. It was 2:30 in the morning. The front desk staff was apathetic and could care less, though they did move us to a new room. Needless to say, we did not get any sleep that night. We had a 6 hour drive ahead of us the next day. The general manager was nowhere to be found when we checked out in the morning. I left my contact information and a report was supposedly written about the incident. I never received a call from anyone at the hotel, despite my many messages over the next four days. I finally contacted someone in the corporate office. Only then did the Fairfield Inn - Phoenix call me. The manager had the audacity to only offer a 50% refund of my payment because I did actually stay for the full night. A call to corporate again, and she finally gave me a full refund. My bed bug bites took almost a month to fully heal. I spent over 3 hours on the phone to receive a refund on a $120/night hotel. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! DON'T SUBJECT YOURSELF TO SUCH AWFUL TREATMENT AND LACK OF CARE!

Reviews.Title: “Not typical of something with the Marriott branding...”
Reviews.Author: ascdoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be average for something like a Best Western. The entire area was REALLY boring and in places somewhat seedy (not the faulty of the hotel, of course). If I had to come back to Phoenix, I would probably choose something right in the heart of downtown and closer to ASU. There seemed to be more to do there. The decor of this hotel was typical lower-end Southwest pastel although the lobby/breakfast area were decent. The pool was nasty, period. The bed was not very comfortable and the shades did not appropriately cover the window to block out all of the light. And to boot, if someone closed their door quietly down the hall, they might as well have been slamming it (poor noise control). The free (and close) parking was nice. The staff was relatively friendly, and they had a decent gym. After staying at the Courtyard Marriott in Surprise (AZ) the night before, this hotel was more expensive and definitely a let-down.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: scubamom
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Fairfield Inn for the Heard Museum Indian Market and found it just as delightful as the year before. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, and plenty to choose from for breakfast. We also took advantage of the complimentary airport pickup and drop off, saving us quite a bit in taxi fare. We also enjoyed dining at Durants Steakhouse only a block away and also loved Switch Restaurant near Durants. Switch was so good that we went back for lunch as well as dinner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Positive Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CantW8toGoAgain
Reviews.Content: We flew into and out of Phoenix and stayed here on the first day and last day of our week long trip to Sedona, Arizona. From the friendly reception (thank you, Lance!) to the free airport shuttle service (thank you, James!) the individuals employed here were truly professional. The complimentary breakfast offered an extensive variety of food. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Heard Museum (don't miss this) and is located next to the light rail. The jacuzzi and pool area was very clean and a relaxing way to end the day. I researched many hotels and am happy that I chose this one. We will definitely use this hotel for any return trips.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ganotrill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times and found it good for both business and vacation travellers in Phoenix. Service is very good. I tried to throw out a sweater by leaving it near the trash can on my last stay and the hotel posted it back to my Australian address!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocoacvrdkisses
Reviews.Content: While traveling across country I needed a last minute hotel to stay at for the night. I am a travel agent. I booked this hotel because it was close to the freeway. It was late. They were so nice to take our bags. We had a trailer attached to my car so they let us park sideways. Nice big rooms, large beds and flat screen TVs... I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: IrishKelly57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairfield because the rate was reasonable (less than $100 including all taxes), it included breakfast, and it was close to the hospital my husband was in. The room was clean, the thermostat worked perfectly, and the beds were comfortable. The towels were softer than most of those I've encountered in hotels for twice the price, which was very surprising. The showerhead was great. There were snacks available in their mini convenience store in the lobby, which with two teenage boys, was very convenient! I informed the hotel of my two complaints via their survey, which was sent to me a few days after my stay. The choice of breakfast foods was great, however the baked goods were so stale, they were inedible. The bagels were rock-hard. I also observed an employee re-stocking the breakfast sandwiches and milk by just piling the new product in front of the old - she should have pulled forward the older product and put the new in back. My other complaint was the bathroom door - it was spring-loaded so that it closed automatically, and it opened OUT into the room. We had to prop it open after we showered just to be able to get the steam out and breathe. I've never encountered a configuration like it before. We will be staying there again for the next few weekends, and I hope the breakfast issue is resolved. I'll speak to the desk personnel next time to find out if they actually received my survey.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good For Sinus Infections or Allergies”
Reviews.Author: GoDeeGo
Reviews.Content: After dropping my mom and toddler off at the Super 8 on Van Buren, we headed on to our hotel, The Fairfield Inn and Suites. The first thing I noticed was all the restaraunts in the area. That's a plus plus when you're greedy like me. I was especially happy to see a schlotzsky's deli right accross the street. I love their food. Other than the food, i did notice quite a few homeless folks roaming around. But I guess you're going to see that in any downtown area. It's not that I'm intimidated by them, I just find them kind of depressing to see on vacation. Or anywhere, but anyways. The lobby was nice and so was the front desk staff. They gave us a downstairs room, which I usually don't like. I don't like people over me. I didn't complain though. We were in a hurry to get dressed for the wedding we were going to. Also, the room was right next to two other rooms that they had given a large group of single young women. All I could do is hope that I would get a good nights sleep. The first thing I noticed upon entering the room was the strong smell of mildew. I had already been having trouble with my sinuses and this certainly didn't help. I tried opening the window to air the place out, but it would only crack open. By the time we left for the wedding I was just a big pile of snot in a dress. I had to take almost everything in my arsenal just to make it through the evening. It was miserable. After the wedding I went back to the room to get some rest. First of all the walls and ceiling are paper thin. The people walking over our room sounded like they where stomping accross the floor. That ended around 11 pm, luckily. But then I couldn't sleep, the mattress was hard as a rock and my nose and throat stayed clogged all night. On our way to Phoenix I had begged my hubby to let me sleep in instead of getting up at the butt crack of dawn to leave for San Diego the next day. I ended up waking up before him and our son, tired of trying to get comfortable and get some sleep. It was miserable. Luckily, we only paid $69 plus tax for this room. When my mom went to book at the same hotel, they wanted $20 more just two weeks later. It would not have been worth that. Perhaps if I wouldn't have already been having a sinus attack things would've worked out better, but who is to say for sure. I might give this place one more shot if we go back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid value”
Reviews.Author: micmac99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Friday and Saturday night. I live in the immediate neighborhood, so this was just a "fun" getaway. Room was spacious, clean and quiet, on the top floor overlooking the pool. AC was cold and effective which is critical in Arizona in the summertime. Liked the free WiFi. Free breakfast was OK, especially liked the make-your-own waffles. Circle K convenience store across Central Avenue. Airport shuttle also can take you to nearby locations upon request such as the major medical center a few blocks from this property. For my first time staying in any Marriott property I was impressed. I will try to stay at Fairfield anytime I am traveling if I can afford the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: comfam3
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here with my family and it was terrible. We were on the "IHOP side" and we heard nothing but car horns, car alarms, car doors, and people talking all night long. The windows were closed and it was like they were not there at all. We were in room 315 and the floors were filthy. My socks were black from walking around for an hour. It really made me worry about my very young child who was crawling around at the same time. The front desk staff were clueless. I asked them about near by restaurants and the only ones that they could name were the two right next door (IHOP and Burger King) and the one in the hotel brochure. (Thanks, big help) Access was also tough because of light rail construction going on next to the hotel. We were only there for 12 hours so I couldn't tell you what the construction noise was like. I can tell you that I would not recommend this place and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ecrom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, staff was courteous, rooms were much bigger than expected. There was road construction going on at the time but we didn't notice any noise from our room. Continental breakfast was very good, with make your own waffles and other continental breakfast fare. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: ohiobnr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite and it was a very average stay. The room was clean, it was nice to have a microwave and fridge, and checking in went smoothly. The only complaints I have include the heavy road construction and the fact that we were woken up several times throughout the night by loud hotel guests in the parking lot (playing loud music, yelling, etc). I understand that the construction isn't the hotel's fault, which is why I rated it a 4 instead of a 3. But I hoped that there would be a security guard in the vicinity that could control rowdy guests. Since we stayed a few days before Superbowl Sunday, we paid a hefty price. If it was around $100, I would probably stay again. But only if the nicer hotels were booked. The continental breakfast was standard. Waffles, danish, cereal, etc. We also ordered from Z Pizza, which seemed to have a great and unique selection of pizzas. They delivered right to the room, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first-time experience with Wingate Inns”
Reviews.Author: smoothride2007
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Wingate Inn and it proved to be a pleasantly surprising stay at a well-equiped business hotel. We obtained the best rate by booking directly with the hotel on their website (which was extremely competitive compared to other hotels we had considered). The location of the hotel was good for our needs. Parking our rental car at the hotel was free and we never had a problem finding a parking spot at the rear of the hotel. It was also an easy location as a pick-up point for one of the tours we had booked. During our stay, there were a lot of roadworks nearby (and throughout the city area) due to the construction of a new public transportation system, but these didn't really cause us any difficulties. The room was very large with a decent-sized desk provided in addition to the two queen beds. The room was very clean and positive features included nice amenities, in-room safe and free phone calls. The hotel provided excellent and free internet access in the room with your own laptop, both wireless and wired (network cable provided). Also free was a business centre with two or three desktop computers and the free use of a printer - this proved extremely useful for printing off some of our MapQuest directions to get around Phoenix. The free breakfast was very extensive. In addition to the usual toast, bagels, pastries, make-your-self waffles, juice (including cranberry), tea and coffee, there were also some hot selections which changed daily (e.g. bacon, sausages, etc). Eggs were the usual powdered eggs that seems to be used in a lot of US hotels. We didn't have too much interaction with the staff but they seemed friendly enough. We did run into the manager (or someone we assumed was a manager) at the lifts one time and he greeted us and enquired to make sure everything was going well with our stay - can't ask for any more than that! Overall it was an excellent place to base our stay in Phoenix and I would definitely be happy to try other Wingate Inns based our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heavy Road Construction”
Reviews.Author: SEHBedford_Texas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown Phoenix. There is very heavy construction just outside the hotel where the city is installing a light rail. We should have asked to be moved to another Marriott property. The $159/night price was far too high for this hotel even without the construction; however, the room was clean, the bed and shower were decent, the staff was courteous, and if you prefer a hot breakfast over the usual hotel continental there is an IHOP across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAILUAKID
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wed October 10th for 3 nights. The Wingate Inn is now called the Fairfied Inn.& Suites (Marriott), Check In was fast and efficient and we were assigned room 205. The room was very clean and it included two queen beds & appropriate furniture. A new twist was the bed spread which was about two and a half feet wide (Indian Design) and it was draped over the sheets. AC was cold to my wife's liking. Free breakfast included cereal, quaker oats, juice, bagels, English muffins, waffles, & fruit. Pool was also excellent for relaxation and it has a small fitness exercise room. Two coin operated washer and dryers (one dollar a load) are located on the third floor. This small hotel is located near the Heard Museum and the Phoenix Theater (complex). We visited the Heard Museum and it is excellent and a true Gem. I took my wife to the Phoenix Theater to see "Crazy For You" which is a live broadway musical in an intimate showroom (about 500 seats). The show was very good entertainment. This hotel is located on North Central Ave and construction was going on to build a light mass transit system. However, it did not interfere with our movement around nor did it cause any problem.There was only one problem with parking and it was on Thursday night after the musical show as we arrived to our hotel after 11:00 pm. We could not find a parking space on the property, so I parked in a metered stall adjacent to the hotel and right across IHOP. Since we last ate at about 4:00 PM we decided to eat at IHOP. After dinner I spoke to the manager of IHOP and he indicated that my car was perfectly safe as he himself parks there. In the morning I drove my car back on the property and there were many empty spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: DavidW57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of being refurbished while its location and the surrounding area are blighted by the construction of a light railway down Central Avenue. The decor and the rooms were tired confirming refurb is overdue. Breakfast average although it seems to be a favourite spot for the local police to come in and write up their reports whilst enjoying a freebie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bobsterkw
Reviews.Content: Has amenities/service not usually fund at this price point. Desk staff called to check everything was ok and if w needed anything. Neutrogena products instead of "el cheapos". Desk staff were very helpful both on the phone and in person. Great rooms (large) and good breakfast with hot sausage and "eggs" (egg beaters?) Service was outstanding with polite and friendly staff. Nice 24 hour pool and jacuzzi. About the only knock I have is that eggs/sausage were warmed by sterno which gave them a bit fo a checmical taste. If I were travelling to Phoenix again this would be my first choice. Our room was $93 plus tax. Has airport shuttle although we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “The Jury's review of this place is Still Out”
Reviews.Author: sailorshenshi
Reviews.Content: I book the room two days before driving to Phoenix for jury duty. I asked for the goverment rate and recieved it. The staff asked if I wanted to sign up with their TripRewards program at no extra cost or paperwork on my part. I recieved 1410 points minutes after enrolling. My room was 204, standard handicap. It looks toward a parking garage twice as high as the hotel. There is free access to high speed internet if you take a lap top. The free access means you can physically touch the USB cord but you must pay the service before using it. I don't know the price because I don't own a lap top. There is Nitendo game controller attached to the television that you can purchase 1 hour of gaming for about $7.95. I didn't look at the pay-per-view movie costs but I am sure it is just as expensive. There is a business center with two computers and a copier. Nothing can be downloaded to these computers unless you have a floppy disk. I had astronomy homework that had to be postponed because no programs can be downloaded at the hotel or the Phoenix Public Library down the street. I didn't want to compute the mass of Jupiter using the orbiting data of it's moons anyway. The free breakfast was filling. Eggs, bacon, make-your-own waffles, milk, juices, coffee, danish, ceral, yogurt,biskits, gravy were all present in the lobby at 6:30 am. No fruits. A U.S today newspaper was at my door as well as bill. I walked around the hotel outside every hour during my stay because it is a non-smoking hotel. The front and back of the hotel is very quiet. The side facing Central Ave. is a mess with street construction. I think this was a very expensive hotel for a breakfest, shower, and bed for the night but I would hate to see what I get if I stayed at a cheeper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kurseni
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Wingate, and were very pleased. We had a one-bedroom suite, which was large, light, comfortable and pleasant. We were tired from traveling, and happily spent a whole morning in our suite reading and relaxing, and felt very much at home there. The hotel is a very short walk to the Heard Museum, and almost directly across the street from Durant's, an excellent restaurant. It is doiwntown, and on the street where the light rail is being built, so there was some inconvenience, but not enough to cause any real problem, and we would certainly not hesitate to stay there again because of that. We didn't hear any construction noise in our room, or anywhere in the hotel. Our room rate was an excellent value -- possibly because of the construction. The pool area is quite nice, pleasant and quiet. The pool is heated -- but too much for my taste. There is also a hot tub and a nice looking exercise room. Hotel staff were friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. The complimentary breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boxerloverSd
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in downtown Phoenix, most were very expensive, but Win Gate was very resonable. I came across WinGate Hotel on Trip Advisor and read the reviews (all good) so we booked the hotel. It was everything they advertised, very clean, extremely nice workers and the "free" breadfast was excellent ...make your own waffels, biscuts and gravy and all the normal breakfast type foods. Great location. Love it

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Holakjs
Reviews.Content: I used FF points to pay for my two night stay after I a. discovered this property offered this feature b. read the TA hotels reviews. c. discovered that this hotel offered a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. In addition, the shuttle ran every hour to places within a five-mile radium so you could go to a mall on the shuttle...at no additional charge. I had a room for one with large bed (king?) and microwave and frig. Everything was immaculate. Front desk staff was very helpfu! The location of the hotel was good for visiting the Phoenix Museum of Art and the Heard (Native American) Museum. Both were in walking distance. The pool was great for sunning if not swimming. For some reason, the pool was hot tub temperature. Nice sized pool for a downtown hotel. Places nearby to eat included everything from Burger King and IHOP to Durant's known for its steaks. Wild Thai was a nearby Thai restaurant I would recommend for its food and value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: aznate27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend trip for two nights up in Phoenix from Tucson. There were three of us so we stayed in a suite with 2 queen beds and a queen pull out bed. The suite was quite large with a frig and microwave, almost like a one bedroom apartment. The room was clean, and the staff friendly. The rate included breakfest which consisted of eggs, bacon, jucies, biscuits and gravy, sausage, cereal and pastries, not a bad deal for $116 a night. It's more of a business hotel, but I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: yanna
Reviews.Content: This busniess hotel is great because it has a shuttle that will take you to local spots like the convention center, and pick you up too. The room was large and the staff was very helpful. There is construction on Central Avenue for the light rail system, so ask for a room farther from the noise. The breakfast is plentiful but average. Durant's restaurant is very close, and worth the price. Get a reservation, even for weedkday nights. If you go at 5:00 they may take you without one, but there is no sense taking the chance that it is full. Therei is a good Thai restaurant that was recommended by other clinets. Ihop is across the street so you can find something at any hour. I would definitely stay there again. I bid for it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Five nights of great sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Chickenbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wingate Inn for five nights while in Phoenix attending a training conference. At check-in I was offered a choice of floors and was even placed in a room on the quiet side (non-street side) of the hotel when I mentioned that I was a light sleeper. The hotel clerk took the time to tell me of all the hotel ammeneties and offerings. I was amazed! I stay at many hotels in the southwest both for business and with my family, but rarely receive such a warm and informative welcome such as this one. The room was a nice sized room with a mini fridge, microwave and coffemaker. Very good rate as well. I was told that this hotel is only four years old and it seems to be very well maintained. Newspaper delivered to the room door each morning. Nice hot breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, fruit, juice and coffee. Wish breakfast was a bit earlier than the 6:30 a.m. opening, but this was manageable. Burger King and IHOP right next door.... very convenient, albeit for a few street people constantly on the street out front. Good security at this hotel.... night watchman, full parking lot and all doors are secured all day and night. Very nice attention to security here. I enjoyed the downtown location, convenient to most everything and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: sandi8
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an Arizona vacation with our two pre-teen sons. This was a terrific hotel. The morning breakfast was excellent and we all enjoyed the pool and fitness room. Our room was clean and comfortable and the front desk staff and housekeeping staff were very helpful and friendly. We brought along our laptop so we were able to use the internet in our room. We also had a very reasonable rate.My only concern was that when my son accidentally locked the safe shut, the front desk staff knew exactly what to press to open the safe. There was no need to call a security guard or look anything up. Therefore, I would not use the in room safe. Otherwise, I would definely recommend this hotel.We truly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: fudy
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a conference and the Wingate was assigned to me because I made plans late and the JW Marriott was fully booked. When I got assigned this place, I thought I was going to be staying at a Motel 6 type of place. Well, this is no Motel 6. The room was quite nice, wallpaper, furniture, decor was all tasteful and classy. They bake chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon and distribute them in the lobby. The free breakfast was also very good. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. This is not a 5 star hotel, mind you, but for less than $100/night, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler7
Reviews.Content: This is a nice business hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable, and the free high-speed internet in the rooms is terrific. The morning breakfast buffet is nicer than many I've seen, and the staff is helpful and friendly. I'll stay here again the next time I'm in town.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites - Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 2520 N Central Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85004
